dublin_core.dcvalue: Pregnant diabetic patients are often required to self measure their blood pressure in the waiting room before consultation Currently used blood pressure devices do not guarantee valid measurements when used unsupervised This could lead to misdiagnosis and treatment error The aim of this study was to investigate current use of blood pressure self measurement in the waiting room in order to identify challenges that could influence the resulting data quality Also we wanted to investigate the potential for addressing these challenges with e health and telemedicine technology
Telemedicine journal and e-health : the official journal of the American Telemedicine Association
Blood pressure self-measurement in the obstetric waiting room.
